sub_title: Founder, HSI ENERGY RESOURCES a collaboration with Tolea B.V., The Netherlands
summary:
Experienced Captain of the Energy Industry with over 30-years Nigerian and international working experience in major oil services and operating companies in the oil & gas industry, after a 6-year academic stint (post M.Sc) as a University Researcher / Lecturer in Theoretical Nuclear Physics.
Skilled in the full hydrocarbon maturation cycle in the oil and gas industry, downstream refining, Regional & International leadership in Petroleum Engineering (mastery of Complex Formations and Unconventional Hydrocarbon Resources) for Shell, Management of Oil & Gas Projects, New Business Development, Divestments & Acquisition and managing Regulatory & Government agencies.
Strong energy professional with a proven track record of excellence in managing resources and delivering on challenging projects - managing both technical and non-technical risks.
Chairman of the Society of Petroleum Engineers, Nigeria Council for 2017/2018 and member, SPE Nigeria Board of Trustees.

profile_positions.description:
HSI is a proud investor in established Exploration and Production assets and companies with potential for redevelopment.  We understand the unique challenges of underperforming oil assets and we have specific remedies to enhance performance and realize premium value for all stakeholders.

We have a deep understanding of the operating environment, are focused on profitability, high return on investment and focused on profitability with a high return on investment and in a socially and environmentally responsible manner.

www.hsienergyresources.com
profile_positions.title: Founder

profile_positions.description:
2017/2018 Chairman of the Nigerian Council of the Society of Petroleum Engineers, a professional non profit association of over 9,000 student and professional members, studying Oil & Gas related disciplines and/or working in the Oil & Gas industry. 
SPE Nigeria is a Chapter of  SPE International.
profile_positions.title: Chairman

profile_positions.description:
Accountable for setting the strategic direction and executing the growth strategy of Waltersmith Petroman Oil Limited from an Indigenous / Independent Marginal Field operator to a vision to become an Integrated Energy company, operating production of circa 100boepd (including expansion into the África Region), building a modular power capacity of 300MW utilizing gas, driving the transition to Renewable Energy and building the organization into a World Class team of Energy professionals. Role includes leadership of the Finance, Commercial Gas & Power, Technical Assets Development & Management, Operations, Legal Services & Supply Chain Management, External Relations & Government Affairs, Human Resources & Corporate Services  and HSSE functions and accountability for all Mergers & Acquisitions on behalf of the Company.

In role as Executive Director, WRPC, accountabilities include leading the execution of the Modular Refinery Project from the initial Phase 1 of 5,000-bopd to 50,000 bopd on behalf of the Board with direct supervision of the GM Refinery, EPCIC Contractors and the O&M Contractors.

Further Accountabilities, for the Waltersmith & Associates holding company, include management of the 500 hectare Industrial & Innovation Park including coordination of Technical partners (UNIDO), Investors, Funding parties, potential Off-takers and Partners in the Park and managing Government parties and Regulators.

Director on the Board of WSPOL and WRPC representing the management of both companies on the Board of Directors.

Lead presented / speaker for the E&P Leadership Forum at the Nigerian International Petroleum Summit (NIPS) 2020.
Highlights: 1. Award of the Block EG23 in Equatorial Guinea EGRONDA 2019, beating out several competitors. 2. Recognition of WSPOL as the top emerging independent oil company and 3. WRPC as the leading Refinery & Petrochemical Company at NIPS 2020.

profile_positions.description: Providing expertise on Sub-Saharan Africa Oil & Gas Assets, including due diligence for Technical (Subsurface, Projects, Drilling & Production Operations), Commercial (Fiscal terms, Gas Commercial, Contracting processes) and other non-technical areas (regulatory & Government, socio-political) for investment opportunities.
profile_positions.title: Consultant

profile_positions.description:
Executive Director on the Board of both Addax Petroleum Development, Nigeria limited and Addax Petroleum Exploration, Nigeria limited, acting occasionally as Managing Director (MD) during absences of the substantive MD.
In addition to leadership of the Technical Directorate (Planning, Economics & Gas development, Projects & Facilities, Asset Management, Development, Production Sharing Contracts Management), led Addax Petroleum’s input to, and supported Industry engagements with both the Nigerian National Assembly and the Ministry of Petroleum Resources teams on the Petroleum Industry Bill (especially the Governance and Fiscal Reform bills), and the 7 Big Wins (covering National Oil and Gas policies etc.). 
In these roles, I was a resource person as a panelist / speaker on these topics at various conferences and fora (e.g. 2015 Upstream West Africa Summit in Ghana as Key Note speaker, 2017 Dr. Emmanuel Egbogah Lectures Series as panelist, 2017 Nigeria Content Development Monitoring Board R&D Conference as panelist, 2017 Oil Producers Trade Section Executive Committee engagement with IMF/ World Bank, 2018 1st Nigerian International Petroleum Summit / Africa Petroleum Technology Business Forum as panelist, 2018 SPE Oloibiri Lecture & Energy Forum Series as host and invited guest at the 2018 NEITI conference on the Petroleum Industry Bill ).
profile_positions.title: Deputy Managing Director (Technical)

profile_positions.description:
Managing External Stakeholders (Major Resource Holder & PSC liaison) – From October 2012, led Addax Petroleum's TECOM & SUBCOM meetings with NAPIMS and was delegated authority for MACOM on several occasions by the Managing Director. Participated in and led Addax Petroleum team negotiations/ engagements for Operated Assets and Non-Operated ventures in role as GM Development & Asset Management.

Leadership - Accountable for defining long term strategic plans (including resources) across the functional / business units in the technical directorate (corporate planning function, exploration, development, asset management and new business opportunities) and balancing this with medium and short-term priorities, delegating broad goals to the technical planning, exploration, new business and asset general managers after providing an overview of the performance and standards expected. Drove the urban development strategy for life-cycle gas lift and water flood optimisation, allowing flexible deployment of these resources to the fields and reservoirs where most needed.
 
Interface & Stakeholder Management: Formulating and directing strategies for engagement of external stakeholders (host communities, government venture partners/ Concessionaire - NAPIMS, regulatory agencies – DPR & NCDMB) and ensuring strategic fit with the company's overall business strategy.
Key challenges included delivering a gas master plan that addressed long standing legacy issues on gas flaring and domestic gas demand, through the vehicle of a gas commercial framework MOU, which addressed commercial and fiscal terms for developing gas resources to meet the domestic gas supply for the Addax Petroleum PSCs.

profile_positions.description: As Regional Discipline manager, led the Sub-Saharan Africa Petrophysics Leadership team and managed the career development of a pool of over 60 petrophysicists in roles across various aspects of Hydrocarbon Maturation including - Business Opportunity Managers, Asset Development leaders, Portfolio managers, Field Development leaders, Front End project managers, Commercial Managers, Technical Planning leads, Operations and Studies staff etc. Concurrently was a member of the Shell Global Petrophysics and Petroleum Engineering Leadership and Extended Leadership teams, both as Regional Leader and Global Principal Technical Expert.
profile_positions.title: Regional Discipline Manager, Petrophysics

profile_positions.description: Concurrent with the Chief Petrophysicist role, worked as Front End Project Manager for Shell's OML-135 (Deep water Bolia/ Chota Asset). In 2010 led SNEPCo's OML-135 team in partner negotiations (including heading the unit Technical Committee meetings) & block TECOM meetings (involving the NAPIMS Exploration and PSC teams). Also led the opportunity maturation of the Bolia and Chota fields, post feasibility and towards DG2, including unitisation discussions.
profile_positions.title: Front End Project Manager, OML-135

profile_positions.description: Chief Petrophysicist (functional head and technical authority) for the SNEPCO DeepWater assets (Bonga Main, Bonga South West, Bonga North and Northwest, Bolia-Chota, OPL-245 etc.). Also led integrated technical reviews for DeepWater NOVs (Erha and Erha North) through all gates of the Shell Opportunity Realization Process. Technical authority for all petrophysics input to well and reservoir management, reserves auditing, assurance and reporting, field studies & projects and field development & execution. Also managed career development for all petrophysicists in SNEPCO, as part of the Sub-Saharan Africa Petroleum Engineering Leadership Team.
profile_positions.title: Chief Petrophysicist

profile_positions.description:
Recognized as the Shell group's global Principal Technical Expert (PTE) for difficult reservoirs in 2007 and the first Shell Africa-parented PTE. Also was adjunct member of the Shell Global Petrophysics Leadership Team, in role as PTE. Expertise covered primary, secondary and tertiary recovery processes in difficult reservoirs (tight gas, CBM, complex carbonates, low contrast pay) and leadership of a team of 13 of the Shell Group's global subject matter experts in complex formation evaluation. Team leader for the Sleeping Giants project (Unconventional Resources and Conventional untapped opportunities) in Sub-Saharan Africa and member of the Shell Global HIT team for Unconventional Resources. Also global Technical Authority for clastic and carbonate petrophysics and Director of the Shell Open University shaly sand and carbonate petrophysics courses. Subject Matter Expert in the Global Integrated Reservoir Modeling team, covering saturation function modeling, permeability modeling in clastics and carbonates, integrated rock typing in complex carbonate systems etc.

Member of the 2008 Shell Global Must Wins team (focused team of the Shell Group's experts working to accelerate the pace of Shell's Top 70 [T70] and Emerging Top 70 [ET70] assets from early appraisal, Development Concept identification and selection, Investment proposal to Final Investment decision).
profile_positions.title: Principal Technical Expert

profile_positions.description:
Led multi-disciplinary and culturally diverse teams, Qatar Development team (re-development of a mature 12 billion boe asset) with over 20 subsurface engineers (direct reports from Shell, indirect reports from ExxonMobil, ConocoPhillips & Qatar Petroleum), from at least 8 different Nationalities.

Project scope covered IOR/EOR feasibility (improved patterned water flooding, immiscible crestal gas injection, miscible enriched HC gas and C02 floods, including Carbon Capture and Sequestration considerations) in the 12-MMboe Dukhan carbonate asset in the Middle East.

profile_positions.description:
Value Assurance & Opportunity Maturation Management – One of the earliest Shell-trained Realize the Limit consultants (2001). Provided guidance, to project teams, for maximizing the value of their assets.

Organizational Change - Led the Development function (asset operations) re-organization in Shell Nigeria's Core Operations (Producing assets) work stream for the 2004/2005 Securing Our Future reorganization/structural cost review (Themes: a. Driving down unit OPEX and optimizing capital allocation. b. Organizational change - asset and functional realignment) with Booz Allen Hamilton as consultants.
 
Business Leadership – Business Opportunity/Support leader for the largest producing asset in Shell Nigeria (Land Asset East) & Coordinator for all the Asset Development Leaders in SPDC for the 2004-2009 five year JV Business Plan.

Subsurface coordinator for Shell's Bonny NAG & Cawthorne Channel IOGP in the Eastern swamp & Business Opportunity leader for the land asset in SPDC. Engagements included the MACOM, TECOM/ DEVCOM meetings with NAPIMS (investment arm of the NNPC) & JV partners (from 2002 – 2004), Akri-Oguta unitization discussions with AGIP (2002), Field Development planning presentations to NAPIMS, JV partners and DPR (2001 – 2004).

Production - Business Opportunity leader & Horizontal Sidetrack Campaign Theme Lead for the Land Asset in Shell Nigeria, Short and medium term oil generation, Field Development & Execution Lead (Afam Power Project), Well and Reservoir Management Lead, Hydrocarbon Maturation Planning, Integrated Production Systems Capacity optimization, Integrated Activity Planning/ Opportunity Realisation Consultant for some of the Shell Group's largest assets.
profile_positions.title: Head, Petrophysics & Business Opportunity Leader

profile_positions.description: Lead Petrophysicist for several projects in the SIEP EPT-AGI studies group in Rijswijk, including the Umuechem Project (Nigeria), the Dureji Project (Pakistan), the Athaman GOGD Feasibility Project (Syria), and one of the early adopters/ drivers for the 3D All The Way integrated reservoir modeling and management, a proprietary process for optimized field development planning developed by EPT-AGI.
profile_positions.title: Lead Petrophysicist

profile_positions.description: Operations Petrophysicist and coordinator for the Horizontal Well Logging and Evaluation Guidelines in SPDC, which became the authoritative guideline for data acquisition in the early horizontal wells drilled in the Obigbo North, Imo River and Gbaran fields. Also worked as the Petrophysicist for the Obigbo North Produced Water Re-Injection project, the first of its kind in Shell Nigeria. Provided petrophysics support for the Egbema West Dumpflood feasibility, early applications for the Flow Zone Indicator (FZI) modified Kozeny-Carman permeability model to the Gbaran field.
profile_positions.title: Operations Petrophysicist

profile_positions.title: Director, Operations

profile_positions.description: Field Logging Engineer, Cell Leader (Field Services Leader) for Texaco and later Shell, Technical Services Representative and Advanced Cased Hole Services lead (Casing inspection services, including Magnelog, Vertilog, Circumferential Borehole Imaging Log, CBIL, and MFC).
